title: Missing Files from Government Website About a Famous Case
summary: The Justice Department had a website with documents about Jeffrey Epstein, a man involved in a big scandal. At least 16 files disappeared from that website in less than a day, and no one explained why. One of the missing files had a photo showing President Donald Trump with Epstein and others. People are curious about what happened and why they weren't told. Some politicians are asking for more transparency so the public can know the truth. This has made people worry because the documents released didn't give much new information about Epstein's crimes or why he got a light punishment years ago. Important records, like interviews with victims, are still missing.

keywords.explanation: a part of the U.S. government that handles laws and legal matters
documents or pictures stored on a computer or website
a man who was involved in a big scandal about crimes
being open and honest so people can see what is happening
papers or files with information written on them
a picture taken with a camera

questions.question: How many files disappeared from the Justice Department's website?
Who was in one of the missing photos?
What did the Justice Department do when the files disappeared?
Why are people worried about the missing files?
What important records are still missing from the documents released?
What did some politicians ask for after the files disappeared?

background_read: Jeffrey Epstein was a wealthy man who was accused of serious crimes involving young people. He had connections to many powerful and famous individuals. In 2019, he was arrested and later died in jail, which led to investigations and the release of documents to understand what happened. The Justice Department is responsible for sharing some of these documents with the public to ensure fairness and truth.
Article_Structure: WHO: The Justice Department and people like President Donald Trump and Jeffrey Epstein.
WHAT: At least 16 files disappeared from a government website without explanation, including a photo of Trump.
WHERE: On the Justice Department's public webpage in the United States.
WHY: This has raised concerns about transparency and missing important information about Epstein's case.

perspectives.description: People are worried because the missing files might hide important truths about a scandal.
Some politicians are calling for more openness to ensure the public knows what happened.
